comments.body: Can this also impact read_fwf, read_table, and maybe others?
I suspect that's true. I'll check for other formats and add tests for MultiIndex headers with no index.
I've checked the other formats, but didn't add new tests because there are existing tests in place to ensure that e.g. read_table behaves the same as read_csv without duplicating every common test.
Thanks for checking, but I don't quite follow. What tests are you referring to?

When I wrote 

> I suspect that's true. I'll check for other formats and add tests for MultiIndex headers with no index.

I thought I would need to add tests for read_table, and read_fwf, but now I see that pandas doesn't duplicate those redundant tests. Instead, tests/io contains read_csv 653 times, read_table 31 times, and read_fwf 49 times. The tests for read_table and read_fwf are just the minimum required to show that they correctly match read_csv, and read_csv is tested in more detail. So I don't think I should add any more tests for this pull request, but that's just my best guess based on what I see so far in the code. Let me know if there's anything else to improve.
Thanks! I didn't realize this either - makes sense.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +433,437 @@
                        # if wrong number of blanks or no index, not our format
                        if (lc != unnamed_count and lc - ic > unnamed_count) or ic == 0:
                            clear_buffer = False
                            this_columns = [None] * lc
